title: Why can base life survive in outer space where higher life forms cannot? - Quora

response.answer_text: The short answer is that simpler life forms have simpler requirements. It’s like buildings. Yes, you can build a building that’s 100 stories tall, but you have to take into consideration weather, earthquakes, terrorist attacks, and maintenance. If you build a home out of a cave, it might not be five-stars, but a million years later, that cave is likely still going to be around.
Because base life is maybe the higher form of life
